data.title: About DCAA
data.text:
Terri L. Dilly was appointed the Director of the Defense Contract Audit Agency July 2022, and is responsible for the worldwide operations of DCAA and its resources. Prior to becoming the Director, Ms. Dilly was the Director of Program Analysis and Financial Management, United States Transportation Command, Scott Air Force Base, Illinois. She was responsible to program, develop, and integrate the USTRANSCOM budget and manage resources for funding the global Defense Transportation System. She also developed policy and executed the Air Force’s $13.5 billion Transportation Working Capital Fund and oversaw Joint Component Command’s financing in responding to combatant command mobility requirements to meet critical joint war-fighting readiness and national security interests.

Ms. Dilly is a career civilian with 31 years of experience. She began her government career with the Air Force Audit Agency in 1991. Prior positions include cost analyst; audit manager; program manager; office chief; Chief, Policy, Oversight, and Systems; Director, Security and Special Program Audits, and Assistant Auditor General, Support and Operations. She also held the position of program specialist with the US Postal Service Office of Inspector General.

Debbra Caw assumed the position of Deputy Director on January 30, 2023 and is responsible for assisting the Director, DCAA in leading the Agency’s worldwide operations that include nearly 5,000 personnel and an annual operating budget of approximately $650 million. Prior to being selected as the Deputy Director, Ms. Caw was the Assistant Director, Operations Directorate of DCAA, responsible for strategically leading a workforce of 150 personnel who provide information system and data analytics support, investigative support services, financial liaison, advisory services, policy on quantitative methods, and Agency Information Systems (IT).

Ms. Caw was appointed to the Senior Executive Service in June 2015. She has over 30 years of extensive leadership experience in auditing, management, mentoring and coaching to include experience in the private sector. In 2000, Ms. Caw began her federal career with DCAA as an auditor in Palmdale, California. She has since served as a Program Manager in DCAA’s Policy Directorate and as the Regional Director for Western Region.
